flawed_nl_solution:
Karen and Donald and their 6 children are a party of 1+1+6 = <<1+1+6=11>>11 people
Tom and Evan and their 4 children are a party of 1+1+4 = 6 people
All total, there are 11 + 6 = <<11+6=17>>17 people at the beach house
There are 16 legs in the pool and everyone has 2 legs so there are 16/2 = <<16/2=8>>8 people in the pool
There are 17 people total at the beach house and 8 people are in the pool so 17-8 = <<17-8=9>>9 people are not in the pool
#### 9

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 8, not 11. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
